intro: Agrocharis incognita, commonly known as the unknown agrocharis, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
